The large warehouse belonging to the Govt, known as the “Red Birrapks" situated at Minet el Bassahneir the Gabbari Goods Station, and ; on the Bank of the Mahmoudieh Canal will be offered' Sir sale -by public auction at the Goveri)brate of Alttandritt oO May 2{Sth 1905 betweenihlfhoofsif 9r'a.m. andWifiSk;' The bnilding oooupies an area of over 13,000 sq. metres. PROSPECTUS. SHISiCompmiy. has -boeo-foriBed-for the purposes set , out in its Memorandum of Association, Midi in, particular to apquim, under the contract referred to, and to iwte,,fpdMrol B»e„FreehoW.E#a*ell about, 14r500 foddan»:(about 15,00.1 acre*, [ual to 6,p92 h^ot*ra5, or, kl'Si.aq uare rtvtea) situate at Hammam. in the distriot of Aribut, in Egypt, being, a portion, of the estate of H.H. the Khedive of Egypt. The property has been, reported, by Messrs, 8ir Douglas Fox and .Partners, Engineers of the Company and the conclusion of their Report to the Di- The property has been ^ported hpou, by Messrs, 8ir I Engineers of the Company and the conclusion of ed 26th January, 1905, is as followe joined 26th January, 1905, u as follows :— Taking a broad view of the whole matter, we feel that we oan recommend the roperty, and that with a canal constructed and given snftuient water, yonr Company irmed, to acquire, and, work the Estate, should prove a suooess. Accompanying the Report from which the above extracts are made are oalcula- ion. made for Messrs. Sir Douglas Foxi and Partners by Mr. Alohevsky, Iugenior duoe, M a, m#pimum „Ufitup>te, a net profit, of £72,000 per annum. Early application will be. qpte to the Egyptian Government, as reoommended by Sir Douglas Fox & Partners in their roport, for the extension of the Nubarieh Canal to irrigato the Company’s lands with Nile water. The. Cqmpapy, baa^a.recerra of 100,000 Shares to provide farther working capital, in prder to..sepurpMtq^ tjjis^pmpuuy ,the full .benefit of suoh extension as soon as granted,’add in the meantime the laud will ojutiuue to be cultivated with tho water of oiotanae to be cultivated with the water of supplemented by such further wells as the the rted. aod iu the meantime the laud will osutinue to be cultivated with the water of existing-wells and natural rainfall, supplemented by suoh further wells as the Company's Engineers recommend.

Applications for official quotations for the Company's Shares will be made to the Loudon Stock Exchange, and the Bourses of Alexandria and Cairo. Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company oan be seen at the Offioea of tho Company in Alexandria and at the Offioee of Maitre Carton de Wiart, Cairo, until the closing of the lists, daring business hoars. Applications for shares to be made on the forms aocompanying the Proa poet us and for- warded with the amount payable on application to the Company’s Bankers in Alexandria or Cairo. Failure to pay installments when duo grill render payments already made liable to forfeiture. Prospeotnsea with forms of application oan bo obtained from the Company’s Bankers and Brokers. Subecriptioni for .shore, will only be received on the application form*1 accompanying the complete prospectus, copies of which may be paid on application to any of tio 949 ^T*
